RESOLVED_ENTITIES.Ramon De La Cruz's motion to suppress: Ramon De La Cruz's motion to suppress
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the papers necessary to dispose of the m: papers necessary to dispose of the motion

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ramon De La Cruz's Speedy Trial Act case: mechanism for tracking time under the Speedy Trial Act, including start and stop times, tolled during the period of motions and hearings
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Court: court that rules on pretrial motions and applies the Speedy Trial Act, held a hearing on Ramon De La Cruz's motion to suppress
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ramon De La Cruz's motion to suppress: motion filed by Ramon De La Cruz to suppress evidence seized from the immigration checkpoint stop, challenged the lawfulness of the stop and search
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Speedy Trial Act: governs the timing of trials, including exclusions for certain periods, such as the thirty-day exclusion period
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.suppression hearing: hearing where evidence was presented regarding the immigration checkpoint stop and the search of the tractor-trailer, reconvened to explore further Ramon De La Cruz's arguments
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.post-hearing briefs: submissions made after the hearing on the motion, necessary for the court's disposition, filed by the parties after the suppression hearing
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.thirty-day exclusion period: exclusion period under the Speedy Trial Act, during which the clock is stopped, implicitly extends to the time after a hearing needed to allow the trial court to assemble all papers reasonably necessary to dispose of the motion
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.papers necessary to dispose of the motio: documents required for the court to rule on the pretrial motion, gathered by the United States District Court to adjudicate the suppression motion
